attributes.action: Form a coalition government to fight Covid-19.
attributes.additional_details: Alone, this government has attempted to deal with Covid-19 in a way that has excluded vast swathes of the voting public. We are ALL going through this, whichever side of the party line, and all have a responsibility in helping to make the UK stronger, safer and better prepared. What seems obvious of late is a lack of commitment to positive collaborative action. There are great minds across all parties, who's voices and ideas can help us break through this deadlock. Please work together, for us.
attributes.background: It is clear that progress is not being made in terms of forming positive solutions towards tackling the Covid-19 coronavirus pandemic. The divided party-politicisation of decisions is creating more barriers and more delays. We need diverse and focused minds working together to fight this virus.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/551504

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you find out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.

Find out more: https://committees.parliament.uk/work/192/the-governments-response-to-coronavirus/
